pages.text: The $(thing)Beneath$() is a network of very deep caves, directly below the Overworld.$(br)This dimension is balanced around mid to late $(thing)Primitive Age$(). It's more dangerous than the surface, so we recommend a full set of bronze armor and a metal shield as a minimum, as well as plenty of food, water, and other tools.

It differs from the usual Nether experience in a few ways:$(li)You enter it $(l:beneath/beneath#entering)differently$()$(li)Water doesn't instantly evaporate$(li)A bed works like normal$(li)Traveling Beneath is no faster than in the Overworld$(br2)In return, you can find resources like $(thing)Kaolin Clay$(), $(thing)Graphite$(), richer and more exposed $(thing)ore veins$(), as well as other treasures.

pages.title: Entering the Beneath
pages.text: To travel Beneath, simply stand on overworld bedrock for a little while.$(br)To return, stand directly below the ceiling bedrock in the same fashion.$(br2)It's a good idea to $(thing)make a note$() of where you entered, so you can return to the same place in the overworld whenever you're ready to leave.
